result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph K. Williams

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:30 P.M.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ.  Attorney Thomas Roley appears in person.

Date and time set for a Hearing regarding withdraw of counsel and bond modification.

Atty Roley and Defendant are in agreement on Atty Roley withdraw.
COURT addresses defendant and the difficult process it is getting a new SPD Atty appointed.
Defendant understands. He still wishes for Atty Roley to withdraw. 
COURT grants Attorney Roley to withdraw as counsel and excuses him from the hearing.

COURT addresses ADA Puig regarding the Motion to Modify Bond that the Defendant has filed.
ADA Puig requests time to look at motion.
COURT grants. 
ADA Puig is ready.
Defendant makes statement regarding bond motion.
ADA Puig makes arguments against bond modification.
COURT makes findings.
COURT denies bond modification. 

CC - 11/16/22 at 1:00 p.m.

ADJ: 3:33 p.m.

Review hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:40 am.

No contact with victim(s): K.K. or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:20 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Jack Mathie, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $2,000.00 cash bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): K.K. or their residence.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
RH: 6/10/22 @ 1:00 p.m. Courtroom B. 
PH: 6/15/22 @ 9:40 a.m.
CC: Branch 3.

Adjourned: 2:24 p.m.
